articles.headline: Online Lenders Seek to Shape Industry Before Regulators Do
articles.snippet: The companies, which offer fast access to loans for consumers and small businesses, want to show that they can police themselves.
articles.abstract: The companies, which offer fast access to loans for consumers and small businesses, want to show that they can police themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Online lenders are drawing from a familiar playbook in Washington as scrutiny of the business heats up.

articles.headline: In Debate, Hillary Clinton’s Clarion Call for Women Thrills Many
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton seemed to speak to a new generation of women — and to many young men — by assailing Donald J. Trump over sexual assault and harassment.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton seemed to speak to a new generation of women — and to many young men — by assailing Donald J. Trump over sexual assault and harassment.
articles.lead_paragraph: In her debate on Wednesday with Donald J. Trump, Hillary Clinton for the first time emerged as the clarion-voiced advocate for women whom many liberal women had been longing for — especially the younger voters she had largely left cold throughout the Democratic primaries.

articles.headline: The Hawk on Russia Policy? Hillary Clinton, Not Donald Trump
articles.snippet: If Mrs. Clinton wins, she will enter the White House with the most contentious relationship with Russia of any president in more than three decades.
articles.abstract: If Mrs. Clinton wins, she will enter the White House with the most contentious relationship with Russia of any president in more than three decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hillary Clinton made it abundantly clear Wednesday night that if she defeats Donald J. Trump next month she will enter the White House with the most contentious relationship with Russia of any president in more than three decades, and with a visceral, personal animus toward Vladimir V. Putin, its leader.

articles.headline: Migrant Workers in Recreational Vehicles
articles.snippet: Work camping combines elements of the gig economy, telecommuting and contingent labor, and attracts older adults seeking more money and more meaning from life.
articles.abstract: Work camping combines elements of the gig economy, telecommuting and contingent labor, and attracts older adults seeking more money and more meaning from life.
articles.lead_paragraph: EAST GRAND FORKS, Minn. — Michael Shoemaker is sitting at a picnic table in front of his recreational vehicle on an early October evening here at the Red River State Recreation Area. “I woke up to a realization this morning,” Mr. Shoemaker, who is 69, says with a deadpan expression. “The only way I will have a smoking hot body is when I’m cremated.”

articles.headline: What 130 of the Worst Shootings Say About Guns in America
articles.snippet: A study of high-casualty attacks shows not only how porous firearms regulations are, but also how difficult tightening them in a meaningful way may be.
articles.abstract: A study of high-casualty attacks shows not only how porous firearms regulations are, but also how difficult tightening them in a meaningful way may be.
articles.lead_paragraph: John R. Houser was dangerously mentally ill, too ill to carry a gun. Of that, there is little doubt.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Emily Palmer

articles.headline: Corruption in China: Crocodile Meat, Jade, Piles of Cash
articles.snippet: A documentary series about corruption has been shown on state TV this week to underline that President Xi Jinping is serious about wiping out graft.
articles.abstract: A documentary series about corruption has been shown on state TV this week to underline that President Xi Jinping is serious about wiping out graft.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Feasts of crocodile tail. Pricey liquor by the bucketful. A nanny employed just to take care of pets. Bundles of jade bracelets worth millions. A free trip to the World Cup in Brazil.

articles.headline: Hackers Used New Weapons to Disrupt Major Websites Across U.S.
articles.snippet: Users of Twitter, Netflix and other sites reported failures after a company managing crucial parts of the internet infrastructure said it was under attack.
articles.abstract: Users of Twitter, Netflix and other sites reported failures after a company managing crucial parts of the internet infrastructure said it was under attack.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Major websites were inaccessible to people across wide swaths of the United States on Friday after a company that manages crucial parts of the internet’s infrastructure said it was under attack.

articles.headline: A Whistle Was Blown on ITT; 17 Years Later, It Collapsed
articles.snippet: In the interim, the for-profit education company made billions off federal student aid, while students amassed mountains of debt and few job prospects.
articles.abstract: In the interim, the for-profit education company made billions off federal student aid, while students amassed mountains of debt and few job prospects.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dan Graves, a mental health aide in San Jose, Calif., had mixed feelings when he heard that ITT Educational Services had filed for bankruptcy in mid-September.
